intro: Psoralea virens, commonly known as the green psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in late summer to autumn. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small leaflets that are usually hairy. Psoralea virens is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
